0OV1.F.summary: OVS S.p.A. operates as a fashion retailer in Italy and Internationally. The company operates through OVS and UPIM segments. Its products include men's wear, women's wear, children's wear, and infant's clothing; table and kitchen ware; accessories to furnishings; toys; perfumes; make-up products; professional make-up accessories; and bath and skincare products. The company offers its products under the OVS, OVS KIDS, Upim, Blukids, Shaka Innovative Beauty, and CROFF brands. As of January 31, 2020, it operated a network of 1,770 stores, including 775 DOS, 887 affiliated stores, and 108 administered stores. The company was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in Mestre, Italy.

1913.HK.summary: Prada S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, designs, produces, and distributes leather goods, handbags, footwear, apparel, and accessories in Europe, the Americas, the Asia Pacific, Japan, the Middle East, and Africa. It offers its products under the Prada, Miu Miu, Church's, and Car Shoe brands. The company also provides eyewear and fragrances under licensing agreements, as well as operates in the food sector under the Marchesi 1824 brand. As of December 31, 2020, it had 633 directly operated stores. The company also sells its products through a network of approximately 26 franchise operated stores; multi-brand stores; luxury department stores; independent retailers; and online retailers. In addition, it engages in the real estate business, as well as operates duty-free stores. The company was founded in 1913 and is headquartered in Milan, Italy. Prada S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Prada Holding S.p.A.

2FE.DE.summary: Ferrari N.V., through its subsidiaries, designs, engineers, produces, and sells luxury performance sports cars. The company offers sports, GT, and special series cars; limited edition hypercars; one-off and track cars; and Icona cars. It also provides racing cars; and spare parts and engines, as well as after sales, repair, maintenance, and restoration services for cars. In addition, the company licenses its Ferrari brand to various producers and retailers of luxury and lifestyle goods; Ferrari World, a theme park in Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates; and Ferrari Land Portaventura, a theme park in Europe. Further, it provides direct or indirect finance and leasing services to retail clients and dealers; manages race tracks, as well as owns and manages two museums in Maranello and Modena, Italy; and develops and sells a line of apparel and accessories through its monobrand stores. As of December 31, 2020, it had a total of 36 retail Ferrari stores, including 18 franchised stores and 18 owned stores. The company also sells its products through a network of 168 authorized dealers operating 188 points of sale worldwide, as well as through its Website, store.ferrari.com. Ferrari N.V. was founded in 1947 and is headquartered in Maranello, Italy.

2PI.F.summary: Pirelli & C. S.p.A. manufactures and supplies tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles worldwide. The company provides premium, specialty, super specialty, and prestige tires. It offers automotive products under the P Zero, Cinturato, Winter, Scorpion, and Ice Zero names; motorcycle products under the Pirelli and Metzeler names; and road racing bikes under the P ZERO Velo and CINTURATO Velo name, as well as mountain bikes under the SCORPIONTM MTB and the Urban CYCL-e line brands. The company also provides Run Flat and Seal Inside specialties that enable cars to continue driving after a puncture; Pirelli Noise Cancelling System, a tire that reduces road noise; tires for vintage cars under the COLLEZIONE name; and colored tires under the Pirelli Color Edition name. In addition, the company is involved in the provision of ancillary services; car and motorcycle sporting competition activities; the research and development of products, processes, and materials; and the operation of approximately 15,900 points of sale. Pirelli & C. S.p.A. was founded in 1872 and is headquartered in Milan, Italy.

32B.F.summary: Bialetti Industrie S.p.A. manufacturers and sells coffee pots and makers, and espresso machines in Italy. The company offers coffee capsules, and grounds and grains; monovalent and trivalent espresso machines; and moka, filtered, and special coffee makers, as well as coffee maker accessories. It also provides cookware, including plates and pans, accessories for special cooking, pots and casseroles, and molds; coffee cups and accessories; and small appliances. The company offers its products under the Bialetti, Aeternum, Rondine, and CEM brands. The company was founded in 1919 and is headquartered in Coccaglio, Italy. Bialetti Industrie S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Bialetti Holding srl.

3A1.F.summary: Aeffe S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, designs, produces, and distributes fashion and luxury goods in Italy, rest of Europe, the United States, Asia, and Internationally. It operates in two segments, PrÃªt-a-Porter, and Footwear and Leather Goods. The PrÃªt-a-Porter segment designs, produces, and distributes luxury prÃªt-a-porter garments and lingerie, beachwear, loungewear, underwear, and swimwear for men and women under its own-label brands, which include Alberta Ferretti, Philosophy, Moschino, Boutique Moschino, and Love Moschino, as well as brands licensed from other companies, such as Blugirl Folies, Cedric Charlier, and Jeremy Scott. This segment distributes its products through retail and wholesale channels. The Footwear and Leather Goods segment designs, produces, and distributes footwear, small leather goods, bags, and matching accessories under the Pollini brand. This segment also grants licenses to other companies to manufacture Pollini branded products comprising umbrellas, scarves, and ties. The company also licenses the production and distribution of other accessories and products, including perfumes, junior and children's lines, watches, sunglasses, and other products. Aeffe S.p.A. was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in San Giovanni in Marignano, Italy.

4LZ.F.summary: Piquadro S.p.A. designs, manufactures, and sells bags and accessories in Italy. The company was founded in 1987 and is based in Bologna, Italy.

6SZA.F.summary: Sanlorenzo S.p.A designs, builds, and sells boats and pleasure boats in Europe, APAC, the Americas, the Middle East, and Africa. The company operates through Yacht Division, and Superyacht Division. It also sells its own and other branded pre-owned yachts. The company was formerly known as Cantieri Navali San Lorenzo SpA and changed its name to Sanlorenzo S.p.A in 2005. Sanlorenzo S.p.A is headquartered in Ameglia, Italy.

6SZA.MU.summary: Sanlorenzo S.p.A designs, builds, and sells boats and pleasure boats in Europe, APAC, the Americas, the Middle East, and Africa. The company operates through Yacht Division, and Superyacht Division. It also sells its own and other branded pre-owned yachts. The company was formerly known as Cantieri Navali San Lorenzo SpA and changed its name to Sanlorenzo S.p.A in 2005. Sanlorenzo S.p.A is headquartered in Ameglia, Italy.

6W7.F.summary: Aquafil S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells polyamide 6 fibers and polymers in Europe, the United States, and Asia. It offers bulk continuous filament or synthetic yarns for the textile flooring sector, as well as used in hotels, airports, offices, etc., as well as residential buildings, and the automotive market; nylon textile filaments for sportswear, classic, and technical or specialist apparels; and polymers products or plastic raw materials primarily for engineering plastics sector for use in molding industry. The company also designs and constructs chemical plants. It markets its products under the Dryarn and ECONYL brands. The company was founded in 1969 and is headquartered in Arco, Italy. Aquafil S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Aquafin Holding S.p.A.

736.F.summary: Askoll Eva SpA engages in the manufacture and sale of electric vehicles in Italy. It provides pedal-assisted bikes, electric scooters, and accessories. The company is based in Dueville, Italy. Askoll Eva SpA is a subsidiary of Askoll Holding S.r.l.

7IH.F.summary: Tenax International S.p.A. engages in the design and production of low-voltage electric road sweepers and street washers worldwide. The company also provides pre-owned street washers and road sweepers, as well as assistance services. Its products are used in urban and metropolitan, commercial and tourist, and indoor and industrial applications. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Rio Saliceto, Italy.

7L4.F.summary: Elica S.p.A. designs, manufactures, and sells motors for cooker hoods and central heating boilers in Europe and CIS countries, America, and internationally. The company offers wall mounted, built-in, island, corner, ceiling, and downdraft hoods. It designs, manufactures, and sells electric motors, hoods for domestic use, and boilers. In addition, the company produces and sells various range of hoods, gas hobs, kitchenware sterilizers, and kitchen home appliances. It offers its products under the Elica, Turboair, Jetair, Ariafina, Arietta, Puti, and FIME brand names. The company was founded in 1970 and is headquartered in Fabriano, Italy. Elica S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Fan S.A.

8BU.F.summary: Brunello Cucinelli S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, designs, manufactures, and sells clothing and accessories in Italy, Europe, North America, Greater China, and internationally. The company offers women's collection, including knitwear, coats and jackets, top wear, dresses, shirts, trousers, skirts, travelwear, footwear, small leather goods, bags, and accessories; men's collection, such as knitwear, coats and jackets, blazers, suits, top wear, shirts, trousers, travelwear, footwear, bags, small leather goods, and accessories; and lifestyle products, such as dining, home studio, leisure time, and others. It markets its products through retail distribution channel comprising directly operated stores; wholesale monobrand channel that includes monobrand stores; and wholesale multibrand channel, which comprises independent multibrand stores and dedicated spaces in department stores. The company was founded in 1978 and is headquartered in Solomeo, Italy. Brunello Cucinelli S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Fedone S.r.l.

95H.F.summary: iGrandiViaggi S.p.A. engages in the travel and tourism business worldwide. It manages and markets tourist villages through a club formula; operates tours; and provides travel agency services, as well as operates hotels. iGrandiViaggi S.p.A. was founded in 1931 and is headquartered in Milan, Italy.

9WT.F.summary: Illa S.p.A. produces and sells cookware products in Italy. The company provides ceramic pans; pots, pans, skillets, saucepans, and casseroles with non-stick coatings; stone coated pots and pans; and vegetal oil coating products. It also exports its products to Northern Europe and the United States. The company was founded in 1946 and is headquartered in Noceto, Italy.

AGL.MI.summary: Autogrill S.p.A., through its subsidiaries, provides food and beverage services for travelers in North America, Italy, and other European countries. It also sells fuel. The company manages approximately 4,000 points of sale that are operated through concessions at airports, motorways, and railway stations; and in shopping centers, trade fairs, and cultural attractions, as well as on high streets. It manages a portfolio of approximately 300 brands directly or under license. The company was founded in 1947 and is headquartered in Rozzano, Italy. Autogrill S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Schematrentaquattro S.p.A.

ARQ.F.summary: Landi Renzo S.p.A. designs, produces, installs, and sells LPG and CNG fuel supply systems in Italy, Europe, America, Asia, and Rest of the World. The company offers LPG and CNG alternative fuel systems for vehicles, including electro-mechanical components, such as pressure regulators, injectors, electrovalves, and multivalves; electronic devices comprising electronic control units, switches-indicators, timing advanced processors, and other accessories; and vehicle safety and mobility devices. It also designs and builds components and infrastructures for various applications that include CNG refuelling stations and systems for automotive purposes; compressors and auxiliary systems for processing gas from the extraction phase to final distribution; and systems for transforming biogas into biomethane. The company provides its products and services under the SAFE and MED, as well as Lovato, AEB, and Emmegas names to car manufacturers, and independent retailers and importers. The company was founded in 1954 and is headquartered in Cavriago, Italy. Landi Renzo S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Girefin S.p.A.

ASR.MI.summary: A.S. Roma S.p.A. operates a football club in Italy. The company operates a stadium; sells match tickets, and television and radio rights; sells AS Roma branded products through AS Roma stores; and licenses AS Roma branded products. It also engages in the multi-year rights management of players; and sponsorship and advertising business. The company was founded in 1927 and is based in Rome, Italy.

BAN.MI.summary: BasicNet S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, operates in the sports and casual clothing, footwear, and accessories sectors in Europe, the Americas, Asia, Oceania, the Middle East, and Africa. The company operates in three segments: Licenses and Brands, Proprietary Licensees, and Property. It is involved in the development of the value of the brands; and distribution of products through a network of independent licensees. The company's brand portfolio includes the Kappa, Robe di Kappa, Jesus Jeans, K-Way, Superga, Sabelt, Briko, and Sebago. BasicNet S.p.A. is headquartered in Turin, Italy.

BN7.F.summary: CIR S.p.A. - Compagnie Industriali Riunite, through its subsidiaries, primarily operates in the automotive components and healthcare sectors worldwide. The company develops, produces, and sells suspension components, including coil springs, stabilizer bars, torsion bars, stabilinkers, leaf springs, and track adjusters for cars, light and heavy commercial vehicles, earth-moving machines, armored vehicles, and railway rolling stock manufacturers; and precision springs for aerospace, nuclear energy, transport, energy production, oil and gas distribution, and medical applications. It also offers oil, petrol, diesel fuel, and air and passenger cabin filters for original equipment, replacement for original suppliers, and independent aftermarkets; and air and cooling systems, such as intake manifold systems, air induction systems, charged air ducting, thermostat housing and ducts, and coolant pump modules. In addition, the company operates nursing homes, functional and psychiatric rehabilitation units, and diagnostic centers; and provides treatment for serious cerebral injuries and neurological pathologies, as well as trauma or chronic-degenerative muscular and skeletal pathologies, as well as manages Ospedale Fratelli Montecchi di hospital in Suzzara, Italy. It offers healthcare services under the Anni Azzurri, Santo Stefano, Neomesia, and Charleston brands. CIR S.p.A. - Compagnie Industriali Riunite is headquartered in Milan, Italy.

BO.MI.summary: Borgosesia S.p.A. primarily invests in non-performing and alternative assets. The company invests in real estate and non-real estate assets. It also manages alternative assets on behalf of third-party investors. Borgosesia S.p.A. was founded in 1873 and is headquartered in Biella, Italy.

BOR.MI.summary: Borgosesia S.p.A. primarily invests in non-performing and alternative assets. The company invests in real estate and non-real estate assets. BRCA.F.summary: Brembo S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, and produces braking systems and components under the Brembo Racing, AP Racing, and Marchesini brands for cars, motorbikes, and industrial vehicles and machinery. It operates through Discs/Systems/Motorbikes and After Market/Performance Group segments. The company offers brake discs, calipers, wheel-side modules, and braking systems, as well as integrated engineering services for cars and commercial vehicles; and brake discs and calipers, brake master cylinders, lightweight alloy wheels, and completes braking systems for motorcycles. It also provides spare parts comprising brake discs, pads, drums, brake shoes, kits for drum brakes, and hydraulic components. In addition, the company designs and produces Brembo Racing branded braking systems for race cars and motorbikes; AP Racing branded braking systems and clutches for race cars; Marchesini branded magnesium and aluminium wheels for racing motorbikes. It operates in 14 countries. The company was founded in 1961 and is headquartered in Stezzano, Italy. Brembo S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Nuova FourB S.r.l.

BZA.F.summary: ePRICE S.p.A. operates as an e-Commerce company in Italy. The company operates ePRICE Website that offers approximately 1 million products comprising hi-technology products, household appliances, and home and family products; and offers ePRICE home services for delivery and installation of large appliances. As of June 02, 2020, it operated a network of approximately 111 Pick&Pay locations in 109 cities. The company also operates 314 lockers in post. The company was formerly known as Banzai S.p.A. and changed its name to ePRICE S.p.A. in January 2017. ePRICE S.p.A. was founded in 2007 and is headquartered in Milan, Italy.

The company offers quilts, bedspreads, quilts with bumpers, sheets and duvet covers, bedspread sheets, bed clothes, cushions, bathrobes, towels, furnishings, pillows, and cushion and sofa covers, as well as other accessories for bed, terry collections, and table and kitchen collections. Caleffi S.p.A. was founded in 1967 and is based in Viadana, Italy.

COV.MI.summary: COVER 50 S.p.A. engages in the creation, production, and marketing of pants and trousers. The company offers men's, women's, and bermuda pants under the Pantaloni Torino brand name. It also operates stores in approximately 40 countries. The company was founded in 1968 and is based in Pianezza, Italy. COVER 50 S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Fhold SpA.

CSP.MI.summary: CSP International Fashion Group S.p.A. produces and sells women's hosiery and underwear in Italy, France, and internationally. It offers stockings, tights, corsetry, lingerie, beachwear and bath suits, fashion, and bodywear for women, as well as underwear for men. The company provides its products under the OroblÃ¹, Luna di Seta, Le Bourget, Lepel, Sanpellegrino, Well, Perofil, Cagi, and Bikkembergs brands. It sells its products through agents, merchandisers, promoters, and distributors, as well as through its stores and online shops. The company was founded in 1973 and is based in Ceresara, Italy.

CULT.MI.summary: Culti Milano S.p.A. engages in the production and distribution of room fragrances and cosmetics in Italy and internationally. It offers diffusers, refills, sprays, candles, welcome products, personal care products, and various complements, as well as gift boxes. It also operates stores for its products. The company is based in Milan, Italy. Culti Milano S.p.A. operates as a subsidiary of Intek Group S.p.A.

DLG.MI.summary: De'Longhi S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and distributes coffee making products, food preparation and cooking machines, air conditioners and portable heaters, domestic cleaning devices, and ironing systems. In addition, the company licenses its Ferrari brand to various producers and retailers of luxury and lifestyle goods; Ferrari World, a theme park in Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates; and Ferrari Land Portaventura, a theme park in Europe. Further, it provides direct or indirect finance and leasing services to retail clients and dealers; manages race tracks, as well as owns and manages two museums in Maranello and Modena, Italy; and develops and sells a line of apparel and accessories through its monobrand stores. As of December 31, 2020, it had a total of 36 retail Ferrari stores, including 18 franchised stores and 18 owned stores. The company also sells its products through a network of 168 authorized dealers operating 188 points of sale worldwide, as well as through its Website, store.ferrari.com. Ferrari N.V. was founded in 1947 and is headquartered in Maranello, Italy.

RAD.MI.summary: Radici Pietro Industries & Brands S.p.A. manufactures woven carpets worldwide. It provides carpets for various applications, including residential, hotels, offices, marine, aircraft, automotive, and sport and landscape. The company was founded in 1950 and is based in Cazzano Sant'Andrea, Italy.

RAT.MI.summary: Ratti S.p.A. manufactures and distributes fabrics and accessories for men and women in Italy and internationally. The company offers printed, plain, yarn-dyed, and jacquard fabrics for women's ready-to-wear, beachwear, underwear, and handbags, as well as headscarves, shawls, and scarves; and printed, plain, and jacquard fabrics for men's shirts, ready-to-wear, and beachwear, as well as designs and produces accessories, such as scarves, ties, fabrics for bags, and garment prints. It also provides furnishings, including upholstery, curtain, cushion, and home dÃ©cor fabrics, as well as furnishing fabrics for hotels, showrooms, and stores. Ratti S.p.A. was founded in 1945 and is based in Guanzate, Italy.

RO9.F.summary: A.S. Roma S.p.A. operates a football club in Italy. The company operates a stadium; sells match tickets, and television and radio rights; sells AS Roma branded products through AS Roma stores; and licenses AS Roma branded products. It also engages in the multi-year rights management of players; and sponsorship and advertising business. The company was founded in 1927 and is based in Rome, Italy.

S9L.F.summary: Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A., through its subsidiaries, creates, produces, and sells luxury goods for men and women in Europe, North America, Japan, the Asia Pacific, and Central and South America. The company offers men's and women's footwear; leather goods, such as handbags, suitcases, belts, wallets, and other men's and women's leather accessories; and knitwear, clothes for formal occasions, sportswear, and leisure wear, as well as outerwear, such as husky jackets, ponchos, and leather garments. It also provides silk accessories, including ties, foulards, scarves, etc.; home accessories comprising plaid throws, cushions, and beach towels; costume jewelry; and other accessories consisting of shawls and gloves. In addition, the company develops and distributes perfumes under the Salvatore Ferragamo and Emanuel Ungaro brands, as well as fragrances and body care products; and jewelry. Further, it offers men's and women's sunglasses and prescription glasses; and watches. Additionally, the company is also involved in the real estate management business. As of December 31, 2020, it operated a network of 644 points of sales, including 395 directly operated stores and 249 third party operated stores in the wholesale and travel retail channel, as well as department stores and high-level multi-brand specialty stores. The company was formerly known as Salvatore Ferragamo Italia S.p.A. and changed its name to Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A. in April 2011. Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A. was founded in 1927 and is headquartered in Florence, Italy. Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Ferragamo Finanziaria S.p.A.

SL.MI.summary: Sanlorenzo S.p.A designs, builds, and sells boats and pleasure boats in Europe, APAC, the Americas, the Middle East, and Africa. The company operates through Yacht Division, and Superyacht Division. It also sells its own and other branded pre-owned yachts. The company was formerly known as Cantieri Navali San Lorenzo SpA and changed its name to Sanlorenzo S.p.A in 2005. Sanlorenzo S.p.A is headquartered in Ameglia, Italy.

SO.MI.summary: Sogefi S.p.A. designs, develops, and produces filtration systems, suspension components, air management products, and engine cooling systems for the automotive industry worldwide. The company operates through three segments: Air&Cooling, Suspensions, and Filtration. Its air and cooling products include intake manifold systems, charged air ducts, air induction systems, thermostat housings and ducts, and coolant pumps and modules; and oil filtration systems, petrol fuel filters, diesel fuel filtration systems, air filtration systems, cam covers, and oil separators for the original equipment manufacturers of motorcycles, three wheelers, cars, and heavy duty vehicles. The company also offers oil, air, fuel, and cabin filters for the automotive replacement markets. In addition, it provides suspension components, which include helical springs, stabilizer and torsion bars, stabilinks, leaf springs, track tensioners, coil springs and precision springs for use in cars, light and heavy commercial vehicles, earth-moving equipment, armored vehicles, and rolling wagons. Sogefi S.p.A. offers its products under the Allevard Rejna, Coopers Fiaam, FRAM, LP-DN, Purflux, Sidergarda Mollificio Bresciano, Sogefi PRO, and United Springs brands. The company was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in Milan, Italy.

SOS.MI.summary: SosTravel.com S.P.A. operates sostravel App that offers information on flight info, airport info, lost and found concierge, health travel insurance, lost luggage concierge, and travel concierge services. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Gallarate, Italy.

SOST.summary: Southern States Sign Company owns and operates hotels and resorts. Southern States Sign Company was formerly known as Conte Rosso & Partners S.r.l. and changed its name to Southern States Sign Company in November 2012, due to a reverse merger transaction. The company is based in Rome, Italy.

SSL.MI.summary: S.S. Lazio S.p.A. operates a sports club in Italy. The company was founded in 1900 and is based in Formello, Italy.

TCCHF.summary: Technogym S.p.A., a wellness company, designs, manufactures, and sells fitness equipment worldwide. The company offers a range of wellness, physical exercise, and rehabilitation solutions. Its products include treadmills, exercise bikes, elliptical cross trainers, rowers, stair climbers, upper body trainers, selectorized equipment, plate loaded equipment, multigyms and cable stations, benches and racks, free weights, functional training equipment, and stretching equipment; and exercise tools, such as exercise mat, floor mat, set loop band resistance, elastic bands, power band resistance, jump rope, foam roller, wellness ball, balance pad, balance dome, slam ball, and medicine ball, as well as personal line products. The company markets its products to fitness and wellness clubs; hospitality and residential; health, corporate, and performance; and home and consumer segments through field and inside sales, retail, and wholesale channels. Technogym S.p.A. was founded in 1983 and is based in Cesena, Italy. Technogym S.p.A. is a subsidiary of TGH S.r.l.

TD.MI.summary: TrenDevice S.p.A. engages in buying and selling smartphones, tablets, and other hi-tech devices in Italy. It offers refurbished smartphones or tablets. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Manocalzati, Italy.

TDPAY.summary: TOD'S S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, creates, produces, and distributes shoes, leather goods and accessories, and apparel in Italy, Europe, the Americas, Greater China, and internationally. The company distributes its products through directly operated single-brand stores (DOS), e-commerce website, franchised stores, and independent multi-brand stores under the TOD'S, HOGAN, FAY, and ROGER VIVIER brands. As of December 31, 2020, it operated through a distribution network of 300 DOS and 103 franchised stores. The company was founded in 1970 and is headquartered in Sant'Elpidio a Mare, Italy. TOD'S S.p.A. is a subsidiary of DI.VI. FINANZIARIA DI DIEGO DELLA VALLE & C. S.r.l.

UNIR.MI.summary: Unieuro S.p.A. operates a chain of consumer electronics and appliance stores in Italy. The company offers telephone systems, computers, photos, large and small appliances, consumer electronics, and media storage products; and other products, including consoles, video games, and bicycles, as well as ancillary services, such as delivery and installation, extended warranties, and consumer financing services. It is also involved in the online distribution of electric appliances and consumer electronics. As of February 28, 2019, the company operates 512 sales outlets, including 237 direct outlets and 275 franchisees. The company was formerly known as S.G.M. Distribuzione S.r.l. and changed its name to Unieuro S.p.A. in December 2016. Unieuro S.p.A. is headquartered in ForlÃ¬, Italy.

ZUC.MI.summary: Vincenzo Zucchi S.p.A. produces and sells household linen products in Italy and France. The company offers bedroom products, including sheets, duvet covers, duvet cover sets, fitted sheets, flat sheets, pillowcases, quilts, quilted bedspreads, sheet sets, and synthetic duvets; bathroom products, such as bath towels, bathrobes, bathroom rugs, and beach towels; living room products comprising blankets, decorative pillows and throws, pillow covers, and sofa covers; and kitchen products consisting of aprons, kitchen towels, loose napkins, oven mitts, placemats, pot holders, and runners. The company was founded in 1920 and is headquartered in Rescaldina, Italy.

ZV.MI.summary: Zignago Vetro S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, produces and markets hollow glass containers for food and beverage, cosmetics, perfumery, and specialty glass markets in Italy, rest of Europe, and internationally. The company offers containers, such as bottles for fragrances, nail varnishes, and skin care and cream jars; jars for baby-food; specialty containers for wine, vinegar, olive oils, distillates, and liquors; and customized glass containers. It also engages in the glass recycling activities that include treatment and sale of recycled glass. The company is based in Fossalta di Portogruaro, Italy. Zignago Vetro S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Zignago Holding S.p.A.
